result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Stanley Ryan Krosnicki was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: and comply with all treatment recommendations.

miscConds.notes: The fine with DNA surcharge is $3468.00 to be paid as condition of probation.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges subject to jail policies.  Sentence may be served in Dane County.  Defendant may apply for electronic monitoring.  Good time granted.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Stanley Ryan Krosnicki in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 30 months probation, conds: 6 months jail, start today at 7 p.m., may transfer to Dane Cty. Jail. Defendant allowed to apply for electronic monitoring program. Good time granted. Huber granted under jail rules. $3,468.00 fine, payable to Probation and Parole. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. No possession/consumption of alcohol. 36 month revocation, 36 month IID, upon licensure.  Court granted 3 days jail credit. Ct. 2 dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-27-2015 02:45 pm

Defendant Stanley Ryan Krosnicki in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant entered not guilty pleas. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
